discussion.p: LWG makes changes to iota_view so that it no longer falsely claims it's a C++17 forward iterator. A side effect of this change is that the counted_iterator of an iota_view can no longer model forward_iterator, no matter what the properties of the underlying weakly_incrementable type are. For example, the following snippet is ill-formed after LWG 3291:

The problem seems to be that counted_iterator populates its iterator_traits but it does not specify its iterator_concept, so we fall back to looking at its iterator_category to determine its C++20 iterator-ness. It seems counted_iterator should specify its iterator_concept appropriately based on the iterator_concept of the iterator it wraps.
